scud noun [C]
(RAIN/SNOW)
a shower of rain or snow blown by the wind: It was a night of wind and showers and morning broke with low scuds. Scuds of rain gave way to sun as we got near to the end of the lake.

scud noun [C]
(WEAPON)
(also Scud) (also scud missile, Scud missile) a missile (= flying weapon) that can be fired over very long distances from land or sea: One night there were two scud attacks. There was no warning of the incoming Scud. Earlier this morning, four scud missiles were fired at the city. A truck carried a Scud missile mounted on its bed.
